workflow: Autonomous smoke test: Navigate site, explore main features, verify key elements

trace.thought: The goal is to navigate the site and explore main features. Since I'm on the login screen, I will skip login and instead explore publicly accessible areas. Clicking on 'Products' seems like a good starting point for exploring the site's features.

The goal is to autonomously smoke test the site, explore main features, and verify key elements. I've already navigated to the products page. Now, I will attempt to search for a product, as indicated by element 19. After searching, I will click the button that submits the product search, which is element 20.

I have navigated to the Products page and filled the search bar. The goal is to explore main features and verify key elements. I will now attempt to search for a product by clicking the search button.

I have already navigated to the products page, searched for 'polo', and am now on the search results page. The next step in the smoke test is to explore the main features. I will click on one of the product links to view its details.

I'm currently on the product details page. The goal is to explore the main features and verify key elements. Since I'm already on a product page, I will add the product to the cart to explore this functionality.

The goal is to navigate the site, explore main features, and verify key elements. The previous steps involved navigating to the products page, searching for a product ('polo'), clicking 'View Product', and adding it to the cart. The page context indicates that the 'product_added_overlay' is currently displayed, meaning the product was successfully added to the cart. Now, I will click 'Continue Shopping' to continue exploring the site.

The goal is to perform a smoke test. I've already navigated to the products page, searched for a product, clicked on a product to view details, added it to the cart, and clicked 'Continue Shopping'. Now I want to explore another main feature. I will navigate to the cart.

The goal is to navigate the site and explore main features. The history shows I've added a product to the cart and navigated to the cart page. Now I will navigate to the home page to explore more features of the website.
I have already navigated to the home page. Next, I will explore the 'Test Cases' page to ensure it's reachable. I am using element ID 23 because it is explicitly marked as a button.
I have already navigated to the Test Cases page. Now I will navigate to the Contact Us page, to explore another main feature.
I am on the Contact Us page. I will fill out the contact form, then submit the form.

I am on the contact us page and I have already filled the name. Now I need to fill out the remaining fields - email, subject, your message here. Since the goal is a smoke test, I will complete the contact form.
I am currently on the contact us page. I have already filled the name and email fields. The next step is to fill the Subject field.
I have already navigated to the Contact Us page and filled out the Name, Email, and Subject fields. The next step is to fill in the 'Your Message Here' field. I will then click the submit button.
I have already filled out the contact form. Now I need to submit the form. The submit button element is id 28.
I have already navigated to the Contact Us page and filled out the form. Now I will submit it. The next unfulfilled part of the goal is to explore main features and verify key elements.

I have already filled the contact form and clicked the submit button twice. I should now explore other areas of the site. The goal mentions exploring main features. I will now navigate to products page.
I am currently on the products page. The goal is to explore main features. I will click on the first 'View Product' link to explore a product page.

I am currently on the product details page. The goal is to autonomously smoke test the site, exploring main features and verifying key elements. I've previously navigated to the product details page for 'Blue Top'. Now, I will add the product to the cart to explore that functionality.

The goal is to navigate the site and explore main features. The history shows I've navigated to contact us, filled out the form, navigated to products, clicked on a product, and added it to the cart. Now I should click the 'Continue Shopping' button to continue exploring.
